page.title: 03COMMUNITY POLICING-W.LEEDS
page.content: {PC Jewell talks about his job as a {community constable. "From my point of view this area is split into two parts ,there is a village type of community in {New {Farnley ,}where everyone knows each other, and{Old Farnley}which is mostly council houses and estates. In Farnley, because of the lack of facilities for young people,teenagers often stand on street corners in large groups. People contact the police hoping that their presence will break up the youths. "I try to visit all the schools in this area at least once a week to talk to the teachers and pupils. In future years I hope that these children will rely on me to help them. I spend a lot of time going to youth clubs and other functions that they are involved in."
